The funding arrived at a time the cryptocurrency sector has been marked by uncertainty, regulatory debates, and market volatility. Regulatory Safety According to a report by Bloomberg, the company‚Äôs CEO, Mike Belshe, acknowledged the challenging market conditions but attributed BitGo‚Äôs success to its adherence to licensing and regulations, which has reportedly enabled the company to defy uncertain legal environment facing digital assets. The Palo Alto-based company‚Äôs funding was secured exclusively from new investors. Although Belshe kept the details of the investors under wraps, he revealed that they hail from both the US and ‚Ä¶

entry.title: BitGo Raises $100 Million Series C Funding At $1.75 Billion Valuation
entry.summary:
BitGo, a leading Bitcoin and cryptocurrency custody firm, announced on Wednesday that it has successfully raised $100 million¬†in its Series C financing round, bolstering its valuation to $1.75 billion.¬†The funds will be allocated to amplify BitGo's secure and regulated custody, wallet, and infrastructure solutions on a global scale and to facilitate strategic acquisitions.
"Not only are we seeing growing demand for regulated custody solutions in the US, but we're also seeing the demand on a global scale," said BitGo CEO Mike Belshe. "We are very pleased to announce our $100M Series C for the purpose of meeting this growing need and to provide institutions, brands, coin foundations, and others with secure and seamless participation in the digital asset ecosystem." Amid a dynamic market environment, BitGo has registered growth across the board since the beginning of the year. With a 60% surge in new client onboarding, a 20% increase in Asset Under Custody (AUC), a 200% upswing in fiat custody, and a 40-fold growth in staked assets. Notably, BitGo has distinguished itself as the entrusted custodian for the FTX creditors' funds under the leadership of John Ray III. Previously, the company was also selected as the distributor for the Mt. Gox creditors. BitGo's recent funding success comes on the heels of the launch of its Go Network, empowering institutions to trade and settle both digital assets and fiat currencies round the clock from secure custody. With a robust presence as a premier regulated custodian in more than 50 countries, BitGo consistently handles an 20% of all on-chain Bitcoin transactions by value, according to the announcement. Big name clients, such as Nike, have also chosen BitGo's secure and scalable wallet-as-a-service solution to navigate the intricate regulatory landscape.

entry.title: Bitgo Secures $100 Million in Series C, Firm‚Äôs Valuation Climbs to $1.75 Billion
entry.summary:
The digital asset trust firm Bitgo, headquartered in Palo Alto, California, has secured $100 million in a Series C funding round. While the company remains tight-lipped about the participants in this financial endeavor, this fresh infusion of capital catapults the firm‚Äôs post-valuation to $1.75 billion.
Bitgo Raises $100 Million From Undisclosed Investors
Bitgo has successfully bagged $100 million in a Series C funding round, with the investors‚Äô names under wraps, as per a Bloomberg report. Bitgo‚Äôs top executive, Mike Belshe, acknowledged the challenging market landscape. Yet, he emphasized the company‚Äôs commitment to licensing and regulatory measures, noting, ‚ÄúRegulatory safety is top-of-mind for everyone,‚Äù in a conversation with Bloomberg‚Äôs Hannah Miller.
This update comes on the heels of Galaxy Digital scrapping its intentions to snap up Bitgo for a cool $1.2 billion in August 2022. Earlier, in June, Bitgo had its eyes on the beleaguered crypto custodian, Prime Trust, with acquisition plans. However, the deal fell through. Prime Trust soon found itself filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection the following month.
Though the Prime Trust deal went south, Belshe indicated to Miller that a portion of this fresh capital would fuel future acquisitions. He alluded to two potential buyouts already in the pipeline, as cited by Miller. While Bitgo remains mum on this round‚Äôs backers, past investors have featured big names like Pantera Capital, Digital Currency Group, Redpoint, Goldman Sachs, and DRW Holdings.
What do you think about Bitgo‚Äôs latest capital raise for $100 million? Share your thoughts and opinions about this subject in the comments section below.

The Republic of Uzbekistan has approved the participation of another private bank in its ongoing national crypto card project.¬†
According to a press release on August 15, 2023, the country‚Äôs digital asset regulatory body, the National Agency of Perspective Projects (NAPP) announced the registration of JSV ‚ÄúRavnaq-bank‚Äù as a member of the Special Regulatory Sandbox Regime.
Uzbekistan Approves Second Participant Bank For Crypto Card Initiative
In accordance with regulations issued by Uzbekistan‚Äôs Ministry of Justice on December 30, 2022, the Special Regulatory Sandbox Regime functions as a specific framework that empowers certain entities in the Uzbekistan crypto space to offer special services.¬†
The Ravnaq-bank is now authorized under this regime to actively participate in the pilot‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Magazine Donates Third ‚ÄòHistoric Cover‚Äô to Ordinals Institute
entry.summary:
An iconic Ordinal is being donated to the team that kickstarted the upstart protocol. Announced today, Bitcoin Magazine is gifting one of its 23 ‚ÄòHistoric Covers,‚Äô unique one-of-one Ordinals representing our print magazine‚Äôs original run, to the Open Ordinals Institute, a new non-profit dedicated to fostering development of the open-source Ordinals protocol. Launching at the beginning of August, the OOI is a registered 501(c)3 non-profit organization that plans to accept donations, including those in Ordinals, on behalf of the development team. This means that, a short few months after its debut, ‚ÄòHistoric Ordinal #3‚Äô is officially off the market.
‚ÄúWe are proud that this prized collectible can give back to the team that has helped kickstart a new era of building on the Bitcoin blockchain,‚Äù said Namcios, Bitcoin Magazine Editor and project lead of its Ordinals OTC desk, Rare BTC. To date, Bitcoin Magazine‚Äôs Historic Covers have seen over 4.3 BTC in total volume, with our ‚ÄòHistoric Cover #1‚Äô selling for 1.25 BTC, worth over $30,000 at the time of sale. Since its January launch, the Ordinals protocol has caused no shortage of discussion in the Bitcoin community for its much-debated design trade-offs, most notably its ability to enable any arbitrary data to be stored in a bitcoin block and secured by the Bitcoin blockchain. Already, over 20 million ordinals have been minted using the protocol, a feat detractors say is bloating the blockchain. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre honored to receive one of the Bitcoin Magazine Historic Covers, a tangible piece of Bitcoin history,‚Äù said Erin Redwing, President of the Open Ordinals Institute. ‚ÄúAs one of the first and most notable collections launched on the Ordinals protocol, these will stand the test of time. And how fitting that it‚Äôs a cover of the first Bitcoin ape!‚Äù Bitcoin Magazine ‚ÄòHistoric Covers‚Äô are now for sale on popular secondary Ordinals markets, including Gamma and MagicEden.

entry.title: AI Tokens Could Face Increased Scrutiny Amid SEC Targeting Of Artificial Intelligence
entry.summary:
AI tokens have caught the attention of the US Securities and Exchange Commission, as its chair, Gary Gensler, highlighted potential conflicts of interest within the realm of artificial intelligence.¬†
In a series of posts on the social network X, Gensler acknowledged the transformative power of AI while expressing caution about its misuse by ‚Äúbad actors‚Äù to manipulate capital markets.¬†
The statements underscore the SEC‚Äôs commitment to ensuring impartiality in technology-related matters, focusing on outcomes rather than the tools themselves.
We @SECGov are technology neutral. We focus on the outcomes, rather than the tool itself. Securities laws, though, may be implicated depending upon how AI tech is used. Within our current authorities, we‚Äôre focused on protecting against both the ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Biggest Movers: DOGE, XRP Fall to Multi-Week Lows, as Bearish Sentiment Intensifies
entry.summary:
Dogecoin dropped to a one-month low on Wednesday, as a red wave swept through cryptocurrency markets. Bearish sentiment remained high as the session progressed, with the global market cap falling by nearly 2% today. XRP also plunged in today‚Äôs session.
Dogecoin (DOGE)
Dogecoin (DOGE) fell for a fourth straight session, as bears continue to regain momentum, following last week‚Äôs gains.
After peaking at $0.07407 on Tuesday, DOGE/USD dropped to an intraday low of $0.06893 earlier in the day.
As a result of this fall in price, dogecoin slipped to its lowest level since July 19, when price was at a bottom of $0.0682.
The decline comes following a downward crossover of the moving averages, which is also known as a death cross.
This week‚Äôs bearish momentum intensified after DOGE moved below a support point at $0.0730.
Additionally, the relative strength index (RSI) also edged lower, dropping to a reading of 39.10, its lowest in four weeks.
XRP
XRP, formerly ripple, also remained in the red on Wednesday, dropping to a multi-week low in the process.
XRP/USD bottomed out at $0.5918 earlier in today‚Äôs session, which comes following Tuesday‚Äôs high at $0.6275.
Similar to dogecoin above, today‚Äôs drop in price saw XRP move to its lowest point since mid-July.
One of the catalysts for the sell-off was a breakout of a support point at the 40.00 mark on the RSI indicator.
The index is now tracking at 36.76, which is its weakest point since May, a point when the price was hovering around $0.4600.
Bulls will hope to reject further drops in price, however will first need to drop below an upcoming floor at the 32.00 zone.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
What is behind today‚Äôs decline in price? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Chinese Authorities Uncover Massive $83 Million Filecoin Pyramid Scheme
entry.summary:
China is known for its clampdown on crypto-related activities in the country, and a recent development involving a Filecoin pyramid scheme could see the authorities move to intensify their efforts against the industry.¬†
Filecoin Miners Involved In $83 Million Fraud
Lai Mouhang and four other executives of Space-Time Cloud Company, a Filecoin mining service provider, are currently standing trial at the People‚Äôs Court of Pingnan County for spearheading a pyramid scheme that led them to amass over $83 million in illicit proceeds from their activities.¬†
According to a local report, the company was formed in 2018 by defendants Lai Mouhang and Lai Moujun, who later recruited fellow defendants Hu and Liang in 2019. 2019 also happens to be the same year the company kickstarted its fraudule‚Ä¶

entry.title: 2023 Centralized Crypto Exchange Study Highlights Winds of Change Among Top 10 Platforms
entry.summary:
In a report by the crypto market aggregation web portal Coingecko, Binance retains its crown in the centralized cryptocurrency exchange arena, but not without facing fierce competition and challenges.
Binance Leads But Not Without Contenders, Says Coingecko‚Äôs Mid-Year Crypto Study
According to the Coingecko research report, Binance continues to dominate the centralized cryptocurrency exchange market with a 51.7% share, boasting a spot trading volume of $235.3 billion in June 2023. However, researchers noted a significant drop from its March peak of $559.8 billion, suggesting possible weaknesses.
The research spotlighted Upbit‚Äôs perseverance, holding firm as the second-largest exchange. Despite a dip to a 6% market share in May 2023, Upbit rebounded with an 8.1% share by June, backed ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Update: Peter Todd Proposes Expiration Dates For BTC Addresses
entry.summary:
In a forward-thinking post to the Bitcoin-Dev mailing list, renowned Bitcoin Core developer and founder of OpenTimestamps, Peter Todd, has advanced the Bitcoin Improvement Proposal 352 (BIP-352) for integrating user-defined expiration dates to silent payment addresses in a bid to address concerns related to compromised or lost wallets.
Todd‚Äôs idea stems from a fundamental issue surrounding wallets that eventually fall into disuse. He postulates, ‚ÄúWallets don‚Äôt last forever. They are often compromised or lost. When this happens, the addresses generated from those wallets become a form of toxic data: funds sent to those addresses can be easily lost forever.‚Äù
#Bitcoin Update: @peterktodd suggests adding user-set expiration dates to $BTC addresses for silent payments. pic.twitter.com/zI‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC, ETH Hit 1-Week Lows Ahead of FOMC Minutes
entry.summary:
Bitcoin neared a breakout below $29,000 on Wednesday, ahead of the release of anticipated Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) minutes. The minutes will show the United States Fed‚Äôs reasoning behind its last rate hike, whilst also giving guidance on its future decisions. Ethereum dropped to a one-week low.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) extended recent declines on Wednesday, as traders began to anticipate the upcoming FOMC minutes report.
BTC/USD fell to an intraday low of $29,061.95 earlier in today‚Äôs session, which comes after a high of $29,439.12 the day prior.
This drop sent bitcoin to its lowest point since August 7, when the price fell to a bottom of $28,660.
Bitcoin chart by TradingView
Wednesday‚Äôs decline comes despite an upward crossover taking place between the 10-day (red) and 25-day (blue) moving averages.
The relative strength index (RSI) did provide a bearish signal however, slipping towards a floor of 42.00
As of writing, the index is tracking at 44.49, which is also a seven-day low.
Ethereum
Additionally, ethereum (ETH) edged lower for a second straight session, as the cryptocurrency moved towards a floor of its own.
Following a high at $1,842.95 on Tuesday, ETH/USD dropped to an intraday low of $1,816.33 earlier today.
Like with bitcoin above, this plunge saw the world‚Äôs second largest cryptocurrency record a one-week low.
Ethereum chart by TradingView
Whilst the RSI on BTC was heading towards a floor, ethereum‚Äôs price strength broke out of its own support.
The index moved below a support level at 41.00, and is now tracking at 40.83, with the next visible point of support at 39.00.
Should this target be reached, ETH will likely be trading around the $1,780 mark.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect ethereum to fall below $1,800 this week? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

entry.summary: The casual and mobile publisher behind FarmVille and Words With Friends will launch the Ethereum-based Sugartown later this year.

entry.title: Parallel TCG: Inside the Sci-Fi Card Game‚Äôs Closed Beta
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes hands-on with Parallel‚Äôs closed beta on Windows PC to find out what sets it apart from other crypto card-battlers.

entry.title: Web3 Games Need to Compete with All Games, Says Solana Foundation GM
entry.summary: Solana Foundation's General Manager of Games Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about Solana's PlayGG conference and shares his take on crypto gaming and the "play-to-earn" concept.

entry.title: Many Early Blockchain Games Were 'Cash Grabs,' Says Twitch Streamer Alliestrasza
entry.summary: "I wrote them off," Twitch streamer Alliestrasza said of her initial thoughts on many early blockchain games. She tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how her perspective on Web3 games has evolved over time and now sees blockchain games getting significantly better.

entry.title: 'MetalCore' Game Preview: Hands-on With the 'Titanfall' Meets 'Destiny' NFT Mashup
entry.summary: MetalCore is an upcoming mech shooter developed by Studio 369, and it's being developed on Ethereum scaling network Immutable zkEVM. Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin played through the prologue and tested out the recent Alpha 3 online experience to get a sense of the NFT-infused mashup of Titanfall and Destiny.

entry.title: 'Give Projects a Chance,' Says Aurory's Michael Natoli on NFT Game Challenges
entry.summary: Aurory is an NFT-driven game franchise that started life on Solana and is expanding to other chains. Decrypt's Jason Nelson spoke with Aurory Head of Marketing Michael Natoli at Solana's PlayGG event, where Natoli shared his thoughts on the challenges that blockchain games face in reaching players.

entry.title: Solana Is Only Network Ready for Gaming: Solana Foundation's Johnny Lee
entry.summary: Solana Foundation General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how the Solana network will tackle the scaling problem that blockchain games pose for the industry.

entry.title: Com2uS Is Going "Full Speed" on Crypto Gaming: Kyu Lee
entry.summary: Kyu Lee is the President of game studio Com2uS USA. In an interview, he shares the studio's approach to Web3 and crypto gaming with Decrypt GG's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Building a Discord Game with AI and Blockchain: 'Alchemy: Battle for Ankhos' Creative Lead Alex Finden
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson interviews Alchemy: Battle for Ankhos Creative Director Alex Finden at the Solana PlayGG event in San Diego, California.

entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. A key driver, he told Decrypt at this year's EthCC event, was that instead of launching on a rollup or another layer-1, launching a fully customized chain will allow dYdX to fine tune the network for its product's needs.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Solution Lido 'Had Perfect Product Market Fit' at Launch, Says DAO's Biz Dev Contributor
entry.summary: Marin Tvrdiƒá, a business development contributor to the Lido DAO, sat down with Decrypt during this year's EthCC to break down how the liquid staking protocol has managed such a massive lead, how it plans to keep that lead, and the protocol's new dual-governance tokenomics.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.

entry.title: Inside Mighty Action Heroes' Open Beta
entry.summary: Mighty Action Heroes is the flagship blockchain title from Mighty Bear Games. But is the browser-based battle royale shooter worth checking out? Decrypt's Kate Irwin offers her thoughts and a first look at the upcoming game.
